profileText: (Brother of Willie Jones), a Delegate from North Carolina; born in Edgecombe (now Halifax) County, N.C., December 24, 1739; attended Eton College, England; was a member of the colonial assembly 1773-1775; delegate to the five Provincial Congresses 1774-1776; served throughout the Revolutionary War, attaining the rank of brigadier general; served in the State senate 1777-1779, 1783, 1784, and 1787; Member of the Continental Congress in 1779 and 1780; member of the convention that rejected the proposed Constitution of the United States at Halifax, N.C., in 1788; died on his plantation, ``Mount Gallant,'' near Roanoke Rapids, Northampton County, N.C., on November 10, 1798; interment in the private burial ground on his estate.

researchRecord.name: In the North Carolina papers, ca. 300 items.
In the papers of Josiah Parker, 1780-1800, 31 leaves.
researchRecord.description: Collection contains a letter from Brigadier Allen Jones in South Carolina to Parker reviewing the situation of General Nathanael Greene's army in South Carolina.

researchRecord.name: 1781, 5 items.
researchRecord.description: Collection consists of letters concerning military affairs.
